body:
For me, both the "works" and "segfault" versions of the model crash on both of my machines:

|OS|ORT|Python|
|-|-|-|
|Ubuntu 22.04|1.14.1|3.10.6|
|macOS 13.2.1|1.14.1|3.10.10|

This appears to be coming from the pybind layer of ORT (at least from the non-debug stack trace I see in gdb). [I cannot repro the crash using the C API](https://github.com/microsoft/onnx-script/issues/523#issuecomment-1496523812).

### Simpler repro case using Python

```python
import onnxruntime
import sys
onnxruntime.InferenceSession(sys.argv[1])
```

```
Thread 1 "python3.10" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
__memmove_avx_unaligned_erms () at ../sysdeps/x86_64/multiarch/memmove-vec-unaligned-erms.S:370
370	../sysdeps/x86_64/multiarch/memmove-vec-unaligned-erms.S: No such file or directory.
(gdb) bt
#0  __memmove_avx_unaligned_erms () at ../sysdeps/x86_64/multiarch/memmove-vec-unaligned-erms.S:370
#1  0x00007ffff713572e in std::basic_streambuf<char, std::char_traits<char> >::xsputn(char const*, long) () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#2  0x00007ffff7127b35 in std::basic_ostream<char, std::char_traits<char> >& std::__ostream_insert<char, std::char_traits<char> >(std::basic_ostream<char, std::char_traits<char> >&, char const*, long) () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#3  0x00007fffa46a0149 in ?? () from /home/aaron/.local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/onnxruntime/capi/onnxruntime_pybind11_state.cpython-310-x86_64-linux-gnu.so

#42 0x000055555577f32d in Py_BytesMain ()
#43 0x00007ffff7c78d90 in __libc_start_call_main (main=main@entry=0x55555577f2f0, argc=argc@entry=3, argv=argv@entry=0x7fffffffe3a8)
    at ../sysdeps/nptl/libc_start_call_main.h:58
#44 0x00007ffff7c78e40 in __libc_start_main_impl (main=0x55555577f2f0, argc=3, argv=0x7fffffffe3a8, init=<optimized out>, fini=<optimized out>,
    rtld_fini=<optimized out>, stack_end=0x7fffffffe398) at ../csu/libc-start.c:392
#45 0x000055555577f225 in _start ()
(gdb)
```

I tried on ort main (Ubuntu)

```py
from onnxruntime import InferenceSession
sess = InferenceSession("model_segfault.onnx", providers=["CPUExecutionProvider"])
```

It did not crash for me. 

Will try on 1.14.1 as well.

Can reproduce the crash on 1.14.1.

But am able to load the `InferenceSession` when ort main is built from source. I wonder if there was some fix that went in recently. Will try to dig that out.

In the meantime, could ort main be used for your testing @titaiwangms?
Thanks for the check! I haven't built ORT from source for a while, but will try it. @abock you can go ahead and test on you devices if you already have main branch!

Both models worked on cpu execution provider using torch and ort master

```python


â€‹import onnx
import onnxruntime as ort

# thiagofc: tried both
#model = onnx.load("model_works.onnx")  # worked
model = onnx.load("model_segfault.onnx")  # worked

model_string = model.SerializeToString()
print(model_string)
sess_options = ort.SessionOptions()
sess_options.graph_optimization_level = ort.GraphOptimizationLevel.ORT_DISABLE_ALL

# thiagofc: updated InferenceSession signature
sess = ort.InferenceSession(model_string, providers=["CPUExecutionProvider"])
```
Please note the snippet above only instantiates `InferenceSession`. It doesn't execute the model with any data.
Confirmed it's been fixed! Also, test_mnist is unblocked. Thanks!
